body.p: We petition Your Excellency Thos E Bramlette Governor of Kentucky to remit a fine of $30. against Hiram J. Pierce for keeking a Tipling House, Judgment rendered at the March Term 1864 of the Pulaski Circuit Court.
Mr Pierce is a clever, but a very poor man- having lost his house and all his household furniture by fire during the court - and has a large family to support.
We ask your Excellency to remit this fine, as an act of Justice and humanity. The prosecution against Pierce was Set on foot through malice.

W. McKee Fox
J E Casson C. P. C. C
W B Moore
Thos Z Morrow (Morrow)
Sherrod Williams
E L Van Winkle
I know nothing about the malice E L V
I am satisfied of the truth of the statements of the foregoing petition and recomend its favorable consideration.
